intro: Franciella, commonly known as the "moss rose," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Franciella has small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and containers due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
